definition: ordinary people/the "person in the street"/CL:個|个[ge4]
only the official is allowed to light the fire/Gods may do what cattle may not/quod licet Iovi, non licet bovi
pinyin: zhi3 xu3 zhou1 guan1 fang4 huo3 , bu4 xu3 bai3 xing4 dian3 deng1
containing_words.word: 只许州官放火，不许百姓点灯

sentences.english: He pillaged the country of its treasures and of its best people.
sentences.chinese: 他掠夺了这个国家的财富和百姓中的精英。

sentences.english: Ming Leizhou people think of its function, the construction of "Yang Gong Corner" of worship.
sentences.chinese: 明代雷州百姓思其功，修建“扬功阁”祀之。
老百姓都称其为“骨架电话机”。

sentences.english: The people, however, continued to sacrifice at the high places, but only to the Lord their God.
sentences.chinese: 百姓却仍在丘坛上献祭，只献给耶和华他们的神。

sentences.english: He slaughtered the ox and the ram as the fellowship offering for the people.
sentences.chinese: 亚伦宰了那给百姓作平安祭的公牛和公绵羊。

sentences.english: How many common people could afford such expensive fees?
sentences.chinese: 有多少平民百姓能够支付得起这样昂贵的“面圣”费？

sentences.english: People believe that good is rewarded with good.
sentences.chinese: 因为在老百姓心里，好人必有好报。

sentences.english: Nevertheless the people did sacrifice still in the high places, yet unto the LORD their God only.
sentences.chinese: 百姓却仍在邱坛上献祭，只献给耶和华他们的神。

sentences.english: You are no longer to supply the people with straw for making bricks; let them go and gather their own straw.
sentences.chinese: 你们不可照常把草给百姓作砖，叫他们自己去捡草。

sentences.english: He pilled with grievous taxes and quite lost their hearts.
sentences.chinese: 他用苛捐杂税剥夺百姓，失尽民心。

sentences.english: Ordinary people responded positively to the pilgrims who came into their villages.
sentences.chinese: 老百姓对来到他们村庄的朝圣者明确地作出了反应。

sentences.english: Don't take the advantage of your father's authority and force to take things from common people by force.
sentences.chinese: 你不要依仗你父亲的职权势力对百姓强取豪夺。

sentences.english: All the people will hear and be afraid, and will not be contemptuous again.
sentences.chinese: 众百姓都要听见害怕，不再擅敢行事。

sentences.english: " Then all the people shall say, "Amen!"
City people call this "dragon sun-and-rain fish".
sentences.chinese: 京城的百姓们称这种为“龙睛鱼”。

sentences.english: My people turned to me for answers.
sentences.chinese: 接上去，我把我的百姓称为“辛多雷”，血精灵。

definition: ordinary people/the "person in the street"/CL:個|个[ge4]
villager/(Tw) (Internet slang) person who likes to follow online discussions and add their opinions
to live in peace and work happily (idiom)
the multitude of common people (in highbrow literature)/plebeian
